summary: This is an email chain from June 2020 between a Senior Financial Investigator (SFI) from Squad C-40 (FAST) and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York. They are coordinating the receipt of subpoena returns related to the Epstein investigation, specifically corporate records for entities like LSJ LLC and NAUTILUS from Delaware, Albany, and the US Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Senior Financial Investigator (SFI)
persons.context: The primary correspondent sending and receiving emails about subpoena returns for the Epstein investigation, including Delaware records for LSJ LLC and noting missing NAUTILUS entity records from St. Thomas.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The prosecutor who initiated the email chain to request follow-up on outstanding subpoena returns served on various state divisions of corporations as part of the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: They are communicating and coordinating efforts to obtain subpoena returns for the Epstein investigation, with the AUSA making requests and the SFI providing records and updates.

events.title: Subpoena to Albany Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Albany Division of Corporations as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A subpoena was served on the US Virgin Islands Corporations and Trademarks office as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Second Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A second subpoena was served on the US Virgin Islands Corporations and Trademarks office as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to Delaware Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Delaware Division of Corporations as part of the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was actively pursuing corporate records via subpoenas as of June 2020, over a year after his death.
Subpoenas were served on state corporate divisions in Albany, the US Virgin Islands (twice), and Delaware in July and August 2019.
Specific entities of interest included 'LSJ LLC' (for which Delaware records were provided) and 'NAUTILUS' (for which St. Thomas records were missing).
The correspondence shows coordination between a Senior Financial Investigator on a FAST squad and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicating a financial investigative angle.
The email chain demonstrates the use of a USAFX file-sharing portal for transferring large documents related to the investigation.
